title: Lovely atmosphere
text:
Lovely atmosphere with the outdoor seating, nice to be back at a restaurant feeling relaxed.

Server kindly seated us 15 mins before our reservation time. Asked if we had the NHS app, took ours names and numbers as we didn’t. Lots of outdoor seating next to the grass square beside the football museum.

Service was good on the whole, found we were waiting a bit longer for drinks orders as it got busier but the servers were up and down so just had to get their attention. Margaritas were nice, tandoori chicken tikka starter was very tender and tasty.

title: Fell in love!
text: I fell in love with Old Split every turn I took, really gorgeous place with great architecture and lots of outdoor bars and restaurants, plus markets.

title: Superb coffee
text: Superb coffee with milk, lovely strong flavour. Sat outside in the sun but really nicely decorated inside. Happy hour was on so I got 2 large coffees for 8kn

title: Outstanding service, gorgeous hot choc
text: The standout experience from my recent visit was the service. From the minute I stepped in, the staff were so welcoming and friendly, throughout to advising on what to order and asking how everything was. They were so warm and friendly, and that genuine warmth goes such a long way. Should probably talk about the hot choc.. The salted caramel hot choc was gorgeous! Rich but so enjoyable, it was gone before I knew it.

title: Beautiful building, limited information displays
text:
Really beautiful monastery building at the top of the hill but unfortunately very little by way of information displays. Real shame as understanding the history of a place really enhances the experience.

Avoid the toilets- 10 for squatting hole in the ground loos..

title: Chocolate heaven
text:
Outstanding chocolate themed cafe! When I saw chocolate themed, it is absolute chocolate heaven: melted cups of chocolate, flavoured coffees and chocolate espresso, plates of truffles, chocolate cakes.. Very cheap!

Lovely décor as murals adorn the walls. Service is the best we received in Kiev (low bar!) as waitresses were polite and spoke great English. Could be a little slow as it gets very busy.

Bit of advice- don’t get too carried away given the prices and choice, it’s rich so you soon get full!

Also well located in Old Kiev. If you walk down from St Anthony’s Church, there are lots of stalls on either side of the street (watch the prices!).

title: Main street in central Kiev
text:
Great reference point for when you’re out and about as it’s the main street right in the city centre, so handy for navigating. Independence Square is on this street as well as big shop chains (Nike, Zara etc), and leads onto more shopping streets. Strongly recommend visiting Gulliver shopping centre, which is 10 mins from this street.

Lots of underpasses along this big main road- handy for crossing but can be a bit disorientating in the larger ones, which also host shops and small malls.

title: Stunning architecture
text: Must see attraction in the centre of Kiev either as a sight in itself (budget friendly!), or to walk around the inner exhibits and to climb the bell tower. We visited during the Christmas period so the route from St Michael’s to St Sophia’s was lined with Christmas markets. St Sophia square is also the location of one of the New Year celebrations: absolutely rammed, limited to countdown and no fireworks so would not recommend for NY.

title: Beautiful, recently developed
text:
Beautiful site, the only one we went to with English explanations of historical background so very thankful for that! Looks to have been recently developed for tourists with signs and pathways (again, one of the few sites to be catered to tourists). We visited at night so it was lovely and quiet, nicely lit up.

There is some construction work around the site along with abandoned buildings to its side. Doesn’t affect the experience if you enter through the main entrance but when coming down from the cross monument on the hill, offers an interesting parallel between neglect and development (see pic).
place: The Holy Dormition Kyiv Caves Lavra

title: Nice viewpoint over the river
text:
Unfortunately the arch is no longer coloured as pictured in the headline picture but is an impressive large structure, with statues at its foot. There is a great viewpoint over the river and a pedestrian footbridge across to the street of St Michael’s cathedral.

The area hosts market stalls at Christmas time and a music stage for New Year celebrations (great fun with people of all ages dancing to Queen, UK 60s pop, Latin and Desi!).

title: Really love this place!
text: Cute and cosy with great service and great coffee. What’s not to love?! Also a good selection of toasties and soups.

title: Great variety and value for money!
text: Wonderful museum in the heart of the University District! 5€ for adults over 26, 3€ for adults under 26. Great variety of displays spanning natural history, art, anatomy, military and map history. Personal highlight was the obstetrics room- odd on the face of it but absolutely fascinating about how midwifery was developed! Wax models showing layered breakdown of muscles also amazing. The first few rooms have incredible painted ceilings and walls!

title: All. About. The. Coffee
text: Beautiful little cafe that’s all coffee, no pretence. Great value for money with gorgeous espressos and cappuccinos for under 2€. Excellent and fast service!

title: Cosy
text: Lovely cosy place with a very quirky interior and great service. Unfortunately I didn’t rate the coffee or the brownie I had.

title: Thoroughly disappointing
text:
Overall= please please only consider as a last resort! We only stayed as closer to downtown than the big chains but ended up getting taxis anyway.

Pros:
- Located within 2 mins of Abdali Mall and The Boulevard.
- Nice décor.

Cons:
- Felt extremely unwelcome as totally disregarded by staff. No information at check in, not even acknowledgment when you entered the building.
- Large groups of young boys hang around the area at night so very intimidating and noisy.
- Clientele appears to be limited (Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar) so would not recommend to Western tourists.
- Very poor housekeeping- really minimal when done, sheets were not changed for duration of stay.

title: Local gem
text:
Great local restaurant with a wide selection of traditional dishes. Service is quick as it’s so busy. My Shish Taouk was nice and reasonably price at 4JD, however my partner’s dish did not come as described and seemed to have been substituted for a completely different meat (think camel).

I was a little apprehensive entering as we were the only tourists there but no-one pays you ant notice so don’t be put off! Our friends regularly go and absolutely love it.

title: Beautiful structure
text:
Definitely definitely recommend visiting this as it’s beautiful and is set nicely against the background of the bustling city. Free with the Jordan Pass (simply scanned from your phone or printout at the small ticket booth, then shown again at the entrance) or 2JD without.

Also very close to the downtown area so useful landmark for taxis!

title: Truly a Wonder of the World
text:
This really is the most breathtaking place. Not only steeped in history, but naturally stunning and quite beyond belief when you first arrive.

Tips:
- Water- take a bottle that keeps water cold then top it up with at least one other big bottle of water.
- Snacks- it’s huge and can be hard going so take high-energy snacks, hydration gels or Dextro Energy tablets to keep you going.
- Unwanted attention- be mindful that men may follow you about and attempt to include you in pictures. Mitigated by the presence of park rangers and keeping your wits about you, not a major drama.
- Spread it over two days- that way you can really absorb it. We did the Treasury, the High Place of Worship, the Temple and the Monastery on the first day. Then the Royal Tombs and Byzantine Church on the second.
- Plan which trails you want to do- the Monastery hike is particularly hard going as it’s steep and long. The structure itself is visually similar to the Treasury so would avoid if we were to do it again. Good shopping along the way though!
- Visitor Centre map- excellent for indicating the different trails.
- Stop for coffee by the Royal Tombs- really lovely Bedouin bloke called Ahmed owns a big stall. Stop by, so welcoming!

title: On Petra’s doorstep, but very poor service
text:
Overall= did the job for a 2 night stay to see Petra.

Pros:
- Location- less than 200m to Petra, 15 mins walk from small town centre. Also several little supermarkets within 5 mins.
- Cheap considering location!
- Lovely view from front facing rooms (pic attached).
- Free mini bar including water.

Cons:
- Staff- appalling service from Duty Manager who agreed late check out then proceeded to remove our belongings and leave them in reception while we were out. Then denied all acknowledge and was incredibly disrespectful. Staff overall seem miserable and unaccommodating, with a few exceptions.
- Dated décor- very old-fashioned.

title: Unmissable!
text: Make time to visit this charming little restaurant, frequented by locals. Falafel was really incredible and very cheap at 1JD. Loved it here!

title: Hustle and bustle
text: Real highlight was the food as opposed to shopping. Disappointed by the limited markets and souks. Also difficult to navigate if you want to get to somewhere in particular.

title: Highly disappointing
text:
Positives:
- Muhamarah- nice taste but entirely different texture (like couscous, rather than a dip) to standard recipe
- Lemon and mint juice tasty but expensive at £3.99

Points to note:
- Kabsah- huge pile of tasteless rice accompanied by a similarly tasteless, unseasoned small piece of boiled lamb (chicken likewise)
- Spicy potatoes bland and appeared to have simply been warmed up, squidgy texture
- Extremely quiet for a Saturday evening
- No buffet available, to our disappointment

title: Lovely food, poor service- nothing to shout about
text:
Positives:
- Beautiful interior décor
- Spicy fried chicken was excellent, lovely sauce
- Cocktails were great (Korean Colada and Pomegranate Pornstar Martini)

Points to note:
- Service was woefully inattentive, no compassion for customers
- Spicy seafood udon noodle dish was nice but lacked decent quantity of seafood
- Rice portion ordered as side was small
- Music went off several times (played through the internet, often Spanish songs)

title: Beautiful views
text:
Firstly I would echo the recommendation to buy tickets online prior to visiting, as well as seeking a reduction where possible (students from EU=free, etc).

The views of the city truly are incredible and stood out more so for me than the ruins. I would not want to diminish how impressive they are, but have visited a number of historical sites of a similar nature.

title: Top bars and restaurants
text:
We visited for a change of scenery and found it to be a real highlight of our trip. Others have spoke of the area’s historical past as a gasworks. The cafes, bars and restaurants are superb- original, distinctive and reasonably priced.

Thoroughly recommend as an off the beaten track alternative to the usual tourist attractions. Loads of great artwork too!

title: Outstanding quality, cheap, authentic
text: Really gorgeous food, with a particular recommendation for the chilli chicken at 6.50 Euros! Other items on the menu include chicken curry, lamb curry, chana masala and samosas.

title: Superb quality, varied choice
text:
My partner and I visit every time we stay in Berlin. The International stalls on a Thursday evening are outstanding, featuring main dishes and desserts from Indonesia, Spain, Vietnam and many other places. 9pm is a good time to go as it is starting to quieten down, but is still lively.

Nearest U-Bahn- Schlesisches Tor (Görlitzer is currently closed so would recommend the stop after, otherwise you would need to go to Warschauer St then go back a stop to get to Görlitzer).

Do check out the local area in Kreuzberg- very quirky and trendy.

title: Lovely quaint area
text: A haven away from the city with traditional vibes. We found a great little cafe for steaming hot glüwein and hot chocolate

title: Informative and engaging
text: Free! Informative displays detailing the methods of persecution and social suppression by the Nazis. Great level of detail, can be difficult to read properly when there are big groups but certainly still manageable and enjoyable when busy.

title: Stunning artwork
text: Walking alongside the wall gives a more tangible gravity to the historical context of the wall. There is a real variety to the art work on display, ranging from political statements to the bizarre.

title: Fascinating and in-depth
text: Outstanding level of detail to the displays, although a little dated in places. The price is extortionate but the material covered more than justifies the price. If you were only to visit one museum in Berlin, this could well be it as the museum provides a superb grounding in the history of the city.

title: Yummy, convenient takeout
text:
Positives:
- Easy to order online, including choice of time slot and full menu with pictures
- Food ready upon arrival
- Lovely meal of chicken katsu curry
- Laid out in separate containers with eating implements

Negatives:
- None!

title: Stunning riverside temple
text:
Positives:
- Stunning, impeccable architecture
- Easily accessible by boat en-route to the Grand Palace (do not be tricked into get the tourist boat, get the local boat for substantially less)
- Market stalls selling handmade goods
- Toilets on site

Negatives:
- Very exposed to the sun so take plenty of water
- Respectable clothing needed so take a change of clothes with you and get dressed in the toilets there

title: Picturesque riverside village
text:
Positives:
- Beautiful beautiful little village next to the river, superb for photos
- 20 mins walk from Princes St Gardens
- Can follow the Water of Leith pathway from here or to here

Negatives:
- None. Just take in the scenery!

title: Scenic beach
text:
Positives:
- Lovely scenery
- Clean beach
- Warm water, great for swimming
- A number of the hotels in Hoi An offer a free shuttle bus service to it
- Several cafés along the front

Negatives:
- Do not be deceived by clouds.. it’s still scorching hot! (in August)

title: Superb variety of quality food
text:
Positives:
- Huge variety of quality food choices, from Spanish to seafood to Italian
- Divine dessert stalls
- Fresh fruit and vegetables market next to the food hall

Negatives:
- Can get extremely busy so wait times are long and seats limited

title: Democracy in action
text:
Positives:
- Requested and received tickets to attend 4pm-6pm chamber session only a few hours’ before
- Very welcoming and knowledgable staff
- Unusual, artsy architecture
- Can stay for however long you want when attending the live sessions
- TV displays above seating area

Negatives:
- Educational displays about Parliament were limited in detail and scope

title: Amazing lime and coriander chicken wrap!
text:
Positives:
- Amazing lime and chicken wrap, with cheese, onion and salsa (under £5)
- Range of options, including soups, sandwiches, paninis, wraps and sweet treats
- Lovely staff, happy to recommend particular options if asked

Negatives:
- Bit of a walk if you are staying in the Old Town
- Wish I had bought another wrap for the train home

title: Cosy but pretentious speakeasy
text:
Positives:
- Quirky hidden bar
- Intimate and cosy space-
dimly lit, great period décor
- Joan Collins cocktail was refreshing and tasty (£8.50)
- Barman very knowledgable

Negatives:
- Felt like outsiders when entering
- Staff came across as disdainful when asking about our drink preferences
- Staff came across as pretentious- unwarranted given cocktails were relatively run of the mill combinations of flavours
